userPass module

class userPass.UserPass(user='', password='')[source]

Bases: object

check_passw(checked_passw, stored_passw)[source]
The check_passw function takes two arguments:

  1. checked_passw - the password that is being checked against the stored password

  2. stored_passw - the hashed and salted version of a user’s password, which is retrieved from

    our database

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • checked_passw – Store the password that is entered by the user

  • stored_passw – Store the password that is hashed and salted

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_random_user_passw()[source]
The get_random_user_passw function generates a random username and password.

The function uses the string module to generate a random lowercase letter for the username, and then concatenates three of these letters together to form the username.

For generating the password, we use both uppercase and lowercase letters from string module.

Parameters:

self – Refer to the current instance of a class

Returns:

The user and password as a string

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_user_info()[source]
The get_user_info function is used to get the user information from the database.

It takes in a username and returns a boolean value for whether or not that user exists, as well as if they are an admin or not.

Parameters:

self – Represent the instance of the class

Returns:

The user’s id, is_valid and is_admin

Doc-author:

Trelent

hashed_passwd()[source]

The hashed_passwd function takes the password from the user and encodes it into a byte string. Then, using bcrypt’s hashpw function, we generate a salt for our password and then hash it. The hashed value is returned to be stored in our database.

Parameters:

self – Make the method a bound method, which means that it can be called on an instance of the class

Returns:

The hashed password

Doc-author:

Trelent

login_user()[source]
The login_user function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password as input, and returns a record of the user if they are authenticated. If not, it returns None.

Parameters:

self – Refer to the current instance of the class

Returns:

The user record if the login is successful

Doc-author:

Trelent
